page.title: 08ARCHAEOLOGICAL WORK
page.content: In the 1980's two groups would be concerned with archaeological work in the area: The Trust for Wessex Archaeology and the Berkshire Field Research Group. The former is a professional organisation based in Salisbury and one of its field officers is particularly concerned with the gravel area along the river Kennet. The B.F.R.G. is an offshoot of the Berkshire Archaeological Society and comprises interested amateurs who dig at weekends. There are about a dozen active workers in the group. Should anything of archaeological significance in the area be found to be under threat, both organisations would be informed and a rescue excavation would be mounted. The main threat in this area comes from the excavation of gravel, whose importance commercially is paramount.
